Description: Lower half of a mould-made pottery lamp, with a curved underbody and a wide base-ring. Incised into the flat area inside the base-ring is an inscription which may perhaps be translated as `year 18, 1064'. Red-brown Nile silt fabric with abundant mica, organics and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Apparently found in the Scarab Factory area, though this find post-dates the use of that 'factory'. The Scarab Factory provenance is not given by Petrie (1886, 36 or Pl.34) or Bailey (1975). Bailey quotes Peter Fraser's interpretation "Year 18, 1064"; a seemingly unique graffito. Fabric is consistent with Nile Delta production, including Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q553)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 641)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KD.012) (Phase 1)
